summary: This document is a daily lieutenant's log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, NY, covering three shifts on August 3, 2019. It records routine operational activities, inmate counts, and notes that an inmate is at a local hospital with USMS guards and on psychological observation with an inmate companion. The log shows a change in the total inmate count from 761 to 762 during the evening shift.

events.title: Daily Operations at MCC New York
events.description: Routine correctional facility operations including inmate counts, equipment checks, body alarm tests, and religious services. An inmate is noted as being at a local hospital with USMS guards and on psychological observation.

events.title: Inmate Hospital Return
events.description: At 6:37 PM during the evening watch, a +1 hospital return is logged, increasing the total inmate count from 761 to 762.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
Local Hosp (referenced, likely a local hospital)
keyFacts: The log documents August 3, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the MCC on August 10, 2019.
An inmate is recorded as being at a 'Local Hosp' with USMS (U.S. Marshals Service) guards and on 'Psych Obs.' (psychological observation) with an inmate companion.
The total inmate count increased from 761 to 762 during the evening shift due to a '+1 Hospital return' logged at 6:37 PM.
The log indicates a malfunctioning public address system, preventing standard PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act) announcements.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the Southern District of New York (SDNY) case files related to Epstein.
